title: A shopkeeper loses 5% by selling a watch for ₹1140. For how much must be he sells it to gain 5%? - Quora

response.answer_text: Cost price= 100/(100-% loss) x Sale price=100/(100–5) x 1140= 100/95 x 1140= 1200If the profit should be 5% then the sale price should be= Sale Price=(100+%profit)/100x C.P = (100+5)/100 x 1200= Rs. 1260. To summarize if the shopkeeper sells the watch for Rs. 1260, he will get a profit of 5% .
